name: Peroni Lager
serverNotes: Crisp, refreshing Italian lager with clean, light malt flavor. Easy-drinking, low bitterness. Perfect aperitif or with pizza, pasta, lighter dishes. Italy's #1 beer - authentic Italian dining experience.

name: Jack's Abby Copper Legend, Oktoberfest Lager
serverNotes: Traditional Oktoberfest-style lager with rich malt character, caramel, and toasted bread notes. Smooth, medium-bodied with subtle hop balance. Local Massachusetts craft brewery. Perfect with sausages, pork, hearty German-inspired dishes. Seasonal fall favorite.

name: "Pulp Daddy" Imperial IPA by Greater Good
serverNotes: Bold Imperial IPA with intense hop character, citrus, tropical fruit. Higher ABV (8%), full-bodied, bitter finish. Local Worcester brewery. For IPA lovers or with spicy foods, burgers, strong flavors. 13 oz pour.

name: "Lunch Car" by Double Down
description: West Coast IPA, Worcester, MA, 6.5% ABV
serverNotes: Classic West Coast IPA with pine, grapefruit, and citrus hops. Crisp, clean, bitter finish. Local Worcester craft beer. Pairs well with burgers, fried foods, pizza. Hoppy but balanced - great for IPA fans.

name: Allagash White Wheat Ale
serverNotes: Belgian-style wheat beer with orange peel and coriander. Cloudy, light, citrusy, refreshing. Award-winning Maine brewery. Perfect with seafood, salads, lighter fare. Great summer beer, appeals to wide range.

name: Carlson "Oak Hill" Hard Cider
serverNotes: Crisp, dry hard cider from local Massachusetts apples. Naturally gluten-free. Refreshing, not too sweet. Great beer alternative for gluten-free guests. Pairs with pork, chicken, salads. Local craft cider.

name: Wachusett IPA
serverNotes: Balanced New England IPA with citrus and pine hop notes. Medium-bodied, moderately bitter. Local Massachusetts brewery. Versatile - pairs with burgers, pizza, spicy foods. Great for IPA fans who want something approachable.

name: "Be'Hoppy" by Wormtown IPA
serverNotes: Hoppy IPA from local Worcester brewery with citrus, tropical fruit, pine. Bitter, aromatic finish. Community favorite. Great with burgers, wings, fried foods. For hop lovers who support local craft beer.

name: Switchback Ale
serverNotes: Smooth, unfiltered amber ale from Vermont. Malty, slightly sweet with subtle hop balance. Easy-drinking, approachable. Vermont's most popular craft beer. Pairs with everything - burgers, pizza, chicken. Crowd-pleaser.

name: Bridlehead IPA
serverNotes: Bright, citrus-forward IPA from Vermont brewery. Grapefruit, orange peel, tropical notes. Clean finish, moderate bitterness. Great with seafood, salads, grilled chicken. East Coast IPA style - flavorful but balanced.

name: High Noon Pineapple Vodka Soda
serverNotes: Light, refreshing vodka soda with real pineapple juice. Low calorie, gluten-free, no added sugar. 4.5% ABV. Tropical, not too sweet. Popular hard seltzer alternative. Great for poolside, warm weather, or lighter drinking option.

name: High Noon Peach Vodka Soda
serverNotes: Light vodka soda with real peach juice. Low calorie, gluten-free, no added sugar. 4.5% ABV. Sweet but refreshing peach flavor. Great summer drink or lighter alternative. Appeals to guests who want lower ABV, fewer calories.

name: High Noon Watermelon Vodka Soda
serverNotes: Light vodka soda with real watermelon juice. Low calorie, gluten-free, no added sugar. 4.5% ABV. Fresh, summery watermelon taste. Perfect warm weather drink or light option. Good alternative to beer or heavy cocktails.

name: Allagash, Curieux, Barrel Aged Tripel
serverNotes: Belgian Tripel aged in bourbon barrels. Complex with vanilla, oak, caramel, spice. High ABV (10.2%), rich, warming. Award-winning from Allagash. For beer connoisseurs or special occasions. Sipping beer - pairs with dessert, cheese, rich dishes.

name: Peroni, Lager
serverNotes: Non-alcoholic version of Italy's favorite lager. Crisp, clean, refreshing taste without alcohol. Great for designated drivers, pregnant guests, or anyone avoiding alcohol. Authentic beer flavor. Pairs with all Italian dishes.

name: Heineken "0.0" Lager
serverNotes: Zero alcohol Heineken with authentic lager taste. Crisp, slightly fruity, balanced. Premium non-alcoholic option. For guests who want beer experience without alcohol. Works with burgers, pizza, casual dining.

name: Sam Adams "Just The Haze"
serverNotes: Non-alcoholic New England IPA with hazy appearance, citrus, tropical fruit hops. Full IPA flavor without alcohol. Great for IPA lovers who can't drink alcohol. Impressive craft beer taste. Pairs with hoppy food pairings.

name: Athletic "Run Wild" IPA
serverNotes: Award-winning non-alcoholic IPA from dedicated NA brewery. Bold hop character, pine, citrus, tropical notes. Full-bodied, authentic IPA taste. Perfect for athletes, health-conscious, or anyone avoiding alcohol. Best-in-class NA beer.

name: Ceretto Vignaioli Moscato D'Asti
serverNotes: Lightly sparkling sweet wine with peach, apricot, and floral notes. Low alcohol, refreshing, not cloying. Perfect dessert wine or aperitif. Half bottle ideal for 2-3 glasses. Pairs with fruit, pastries, or light desserts.

name: La Crema Chardonnay
serverNotes: Medium-bodied California Chardonnay with apple, pear, vanilla notes. Balanced oak, approachable. Half bottle great for couples or those wanting variety. Pairs with seafood, poultry, cream sauces. Reliable crowd-pleaser.

name: Duckhorn Sauvignon Blanc
serverNotes: Crisp Sauvignon Blanc with citrus, melon, herbal notes. Bright acidity, clean finish. Rated 91 pts. From renowned Duckhorn. Half bottle perfect for lighter meals. Excellent with seafood, salads, goat cheese.

name: Alphonse Mellot La Moussiere
serverNotes: Classic French Sancerre with flinty minerality, citrus, green apple. Crisp, elegant, pure. Premium Loire Valley producer. Half bottle ideal for special meals. Perfect with oysters, seafood, goat cheese. Wine lover's choice.

name: Stags' Leap, Cabernet
serverNotes: Full-bodied Napa Cabernet with blackberry, cassis, oak. Elegant tannins, long finish. Legendary producer from famous Stags Leap District. Half bottle perfect for steak dinner for two. Premium Napa at accessible format.

name: Damiano Lecrivequevne Barolo
serverNotes: Complex Barolo with rose, tar, cherry, truffle notes. Full-bodied, firm tannins, elegant. Rated 93 pts by Robert Parker. King of Italian wines. Half bottle lets guests try premium Barolo. Perfect with beef, truffle dishes, aged cheese.

name: BV "Tapestry"
serverNotes: Bordeaux-style Napa blend with layers of dark fruit, chocolate, spice. Rich, powerful, age-worthy. Highly rated (94 pts). From legendary Beaulieu Vineyard. Half bottle great for special occasions without full commitment. Pairs with prime cuts, lamb.

name: Moillard Père & Fils Brut Granville Cuvée
serverNotes: True French Champagne with fine bubbles, brioche, apple, toast notes. Elegant, balanced, celebratory. Rated 90 pts. Half bottle perfect for romantic dinners or small celebrations. Pairs with oysters, caviar, appetizers. Special occasion wine.

name: Barrel Aged Sangria
description: Enjoy Red or White 1/2 Carafe...19, Full Carafe...38

name: Bonsoleil
description: Fresh Pineapple & Lime, Green Chartreuse, Hildegard Von Bingen Gin

name: Carnivale
description: Dummshambo Brazilian Pineapple Gin, Yuzu, Lime, Cane Sugar, Bruleed lime

name: Blueberry Bombshell
description: Cold River Blueberry Vodka, Lemon Sorbet, Pineapple, Prosecco Float

name: Mango Inferno
description: Ghost Tequila, Mango, Jalapeño, Pineapple, Lime

name: Espresso Martini
description: Absolut Vanilla Vodka, Begi Tossofim Espresso Liqueur, House-Brewed Espresso, Splash of Cream

name: Mi Casa, Su Casa
description: Erbbon Reposado, Fresh Lime Juice, Agave Nectar, Shiraz Float, Bruleed Lime

name: Mind Over Matter
description: House Vodka by Tree House, Plantation Pineapple Rum, Aperol, Blood Orange Sorbet, Lemon, Lime

name: The Via Mai Tai
description: Erbbon Reposado & Bacb & Son Amaretto, Domaine De Canton Syrup, Fresh Lime, Pineapple Juice and Amerena Cherry *ALLERGY: This drink recipe contains Almonds*

name: Il Gentiluomo (The Gentleman)
description: Bow London Dry Gin, Elderflower Liqueur, Prosecco, Lemon

name: Plane Crash
description: Jefferson's Small Batch Bourbon Infused with Smoked Honey, Aperol, Amaro dell'Etna and Fresh Lemon

name: Raspberry Mojito
description: Our Classic made with Privateer Rum from Ipswich, MA *Also available with Pineapple Rum*

name: Pear Blossom
description: Pear Purée, Lemon Juice, Fever-Tree Elderflower Tonic & Vanilla Bean

name: Toothless Mule
description: Apple Cider, Passionfruit Purée, Rosemary, Fever-Tree Ginger Beer

name: Free Spritz
description: Blood Orange Juice, Cranberry Purée, Lime Juice, Ginger Beer, Passionfruit Purée, Fever-Tree Chilled Aperitif Non-Alcoholic Syrup

name: "Rosina" Barbera D'Asti Superiore
serverNotes: Medium-bodied with bright cherry and plum flavors. High acidity makes it food-friendly. Pairs well with tomato-based dishes, charcuterie, and pasta. A classic Piedmont wine that's versatile and approachable.

name: San Felice Chianti Classico
serverNotes: Medium-bodied Sangiovese blend with red cherry, dried herbs, and hints of leather. Balanced acidity and soft tannins. Perfect with red sauce pasta, pizza, grilled meats. Classic Tuscan table wine.

name: Ascher Barolo
serverNotes: Full-bodied 'King of Wines' from Nebbiolo grape. Complex with rose, tar, dark cherry, and truffle notes. Firm tannins, high acidity. Best with rich dishes like braised meats, truffle pasta, or aged cheese. Premium Italian wine.

name: Bussola Valpolicella Ripasso
serverNotes: Medium to full-bodied with rich cherry, raisin, and spice. Made using 'ripasso' method (re-fermented on Amarone grape skins). Smooth, velvety texture. Pairs beautifully with osso buco, roasted meats, risotto. Step up from regular Valpolicella.

name: Caprizzo Brunello di Montalcino
serverNotes: Full-bodied, elegant Sangiovese from Montalcino. Complex with dark cherry, leather, tobacco, and herbs. Structured tannins, long finish. Highly rated (95 pts). Perfect for special occasions, pairs with steak, lamb, aged cheese. Premium Tuscan wine.

name: Rubio by San Polo
serverNotes: Full-bodied Super Tuscan from Montalcino producer. Dark fruit, spice, and oak. Well-structured with good aging potential. Rated 91 pts. Modern Tuscan style. Pairs excellently with red meats, aged cheese, hearty Italian dishes.

name: "O'Lillo" by Baracchi
serverNotes: Medium to full-bodied Tuscan blend with Sangiovese and international grapes. Bright red fruit, soft tannins, approachable. Modern Italian style that appeals to both traditional and new world wine drinkers. Versatile with many dishes.

name: Felino Malbec
serverNotes: Medium to full-bodied with bold dark fruit, plum, and hints of cocoa. Smooth, velvety texture with soft tannins. High altitude Argentinian wine (93 pts). Excellent with grilled meats, especially steak. Great value.

name: Stags' Leap Merlot
serverNotes: Full-bodied Napa Merlot with plush black cherry, chocolate, and subtle oak. Elegant, smooth tannins, long finish. Highly rated (95 pts). Perfect for red meat dishes. Premium California wine from legendary producer.

name: Siduri
serverNotes: Light to medium-bodied organic Oregon Pinot with red cherry, raspberry, earthy notes. Silky texture, bright acidity. Sustainably farmed. Pairs with salmon, duck, mushroom dishes, lighter fare. Classic Pacific Northwest style.

name: Cambria "Julia's Vineyard"
serverNotes: Medium-bodied California Pinot with ripe cherry, strawberry, vanilla, and spice. Smooth, approachable with balanced oak. Organic, sustainably farmed. Versatile food wine - works with poultry, pork, lighter seafood.

name: "The Pessimist" by Daou
serverNotes: Full-bodied Paso Robles Cabernet blend with dark fruit, chocolate, and spice. Well-structured with smooth tannins. Highly rated (JD 92). Bold, crowd-pleasing style. Pairs with steaks, lamb, hearty pasta. Great value premium Cab.

name: Greenwing Cabernet by Duckhorn
serverNotes: Full-bodied Washington Cabernet with dark berry, mocha, and spice. Smooth, accessible with supple tannins. From renowned Duckhorn family. Excellent with beef, pork, or aged cheese. Pacific Northwest Cab at its best.

name: Band of Vintners Cabernet
serverNotes: Full-bodied Napa Cab with rich blackberry, cassis, and oak. Structured tannins, long finish. Robert Parker 92 points. True Napa expression. Perfect for special occasions, pairs with prime cuts, lamb, strong cheese.

name: Cakebread "Mullan Road"
serverNotes: Full-bodied red blend from legendary Cakebread. Black fruit, espresso, and spice. Velvety texture with integrated tannins. From premium Washington vineyards. Excellent with beef tenderloin, short ribs. World-class winemaking.

name: Austin Hope Cabernet
serverNotes: Bold, full-bodied Paso Cabernet with jammy black fruit, vanilla, and chocolate. Rich, opulent style with big tannins. Cult favorite from Central Coast. Pairs with ribeye, BBQ, bold flavored dishes. Impressive by-the-glass selection.

name: Matua
serverNotes: Crisp, refreshing New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc with bright grapefruit, passion fruit, and fresh-cut grass. High acidity, clean finish. Perfect aperitif or with seafood, salads, goat cheese. Classic Kiwi style that's always popular.

name: Knights Bridge "Pont de Chevalier"
serverNotes: California Sauvignon Blanc with citrus, melon, and subtle oak influence. More rounded than NZ style with balanced acidity. Elegant, food-friendly. Pairs with seafood, chicken, creamy pasta. Premium domestic option.

name: La Crema
serverNotes: Medium-bodied California Chardonnay with apple, pear, vanilla, and butter notes. Partial oak aging adds richness. Balanced, approachable style. Versatile with seafood, poultry, cream sauces. Crowd-pleasing, reliable choice.

name: Rombauer
serverNotes: Full-bodied, luxurious Chardonnay with ripe tropical fruit, butter, and toasty oak. Rich, creamy texture from malolactic fermentation. Cult classic - highly sought after. Perfect with lobster, scallops, rich poultry dishes. Premium by-the-glass offering.

name: La Fiera Pinot Grigio
serverNotes: Light, crisp Italian Pinot Grigio with citrus, green apple, and mineral notes. Refreshing, easy-drinking. Perfect aperitif or with light seafood, salads, antipasto. Classic Italian white that appeals to most palates.

name: Loosen Riesling
serverNotes: Off-dry German Riesling with peach, apricot, and honey notes. Balanced sweetness with bright acidity. Versatile - works with spicy dishes, Asian cuisine, pork, or alone. Great for those who want something different.

name: GD Valle Realis Bello
serverNotes: Light-bodied Piedmont white with floral, citrus, and stone fruit notes. Crisp acidity, refreshing finish. Lesser-known Italian grape variety. Great conversation starter, pairs with seafood, light pasta, summer salads.

name: Guado Al Tasso, Vermentino
serverNotes: Medium-bodied Tuscan Vermentino with citrus, white peach, and herbal notes. Crisp with mineral finish. Coastal Italian variety. Excellent with seafood, especially shellfish. From renowned Antinori estate - premium quality.

name: Gianni Gagliardo Roero Arneis
serverNotes: Medium-bodied Piedmont white with pear, almond, and white flowers. Rich texture with refreshing acidity. Arneis is ancient grape from Barolo region. Pairs beautifully with risotto, seafood, white truffle dishes.

name: Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio
serverNotes: Elegant, refined Pinot Grigio from premium Alto Adige region. Citrus, white peach, clean mineral finish. More complex than typical PG. Iconic Italian brand. Excellent with seafood, light chicken, fresh mozzarella.

name: Centorri Moscato di Pavia
serverNotes: Sweet, lightly sparkling Moscato with peach, orange blossom, and honey. Low alcohol (11%). Perfect for dessert or aperitif. Appeals to sweet wine lovers. Pairs with fruit, light desserts, or alone. Easy-drinking, fun wine.

name: Pasqua Prosecco
serverNotes: Dry, refreshing Italian Prosecco with green apple, pear, and citrus. Light, effervescent with crisp finish. Perfect celebration wine or aperitif. Pairs with appetizers, fried foods, light seafood. Great value sparkler.

name: Pasqua Prosecco Brut Rose
serverNotes: Refreshing Italian Prosecco Rosé with strawberry, cherry, and floral notes. Beautiful pink color, light bubbles. Perfect for celebrations or brunch. Pairs with light appetizers, fresh fruit, salads. Festive and fun.

name: Mionetto Prosecco
serverNotes: Premium Prosecco with elegant bubbles, white peach, and floral notes. Creamy mousse, refined finish. Step up from standard Prosecco. Perfect for toasts, celebrations, or with oysters, caviar. Luxury Italian sparkler.

name: Nicolas Feuillatte Brut
serverNotes: True French Champagne with fine bubbles, brioche, citrus, and toast notes. Elegant, balanced, complex. Highly rated (92 pts). Perfect for celebrations or special occasions. Pairs with oysters, caviar, fine cuisine. Premium offering.

name: Nicolas Feuillatte Brut Rosé
serverNotes: Elegant French Rosé Champagne with red berry, brioche, and citrus. Beautiful salmon-pink color. Romantic, celebratory choice. Highly rated (90 pts). Pairs with sushi, salmon, berries, or desserts. Top-tier sparkling option.

name: World Wide Whites Flight
description: Loosen Riesling, Germany, 2023 | "Matua" Marlborough, NZ, 2024 | La Crema Chardonnay, Monterey, 2023

name: Tuscany vs. USA Flight
description: San Felice Chianti Classico, DOCG, Tuscany, 2022 | "O'Lillo" by Baracchi, IGT, Tuscany, 2024 | Greenwing Cabernet by Duckhorn, Columbia Valley, 2023

name: World Renown Winemakers Flight
description: Band of Vintners Cabernet, Napa, RP 92, 2022 | Cakebread "Mullan Road", Washington, 2022 | Rombauer Chardonnay, Carneros, 2023 | Cambria "Julia's Vineyard", Santa Maria, 2018

name: Carpineto Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Riserva
Gaja Pieve Santa Restituta Brunello di Montalcino
Gaja "Sargaille" Pieve Santa Restituta Brunello di Montalcino
Moutard Père & Fils Brut Grande Cuvée
